STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER ROBERT GORDON
LANSING
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
May 16, 2020
Saginaw Co Youth Prot Council
Po Box 3191
Saginaw, MI 48605
RE: License #: CB730201194
Innerlink Transitional Living Program
1110 Howard Street
Saginaw, MI 48601
Dear Ms. Calhoun:
Attached is the Interim Report for the above referenced facility completed on (date). Due
to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action plan is required.
The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MSA citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (248) 975-5053.
Sincerely,
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov  (517) 335-1980

Venus M. Decker, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
411 Genesee
P.O. Box 5070
Saginaw, MI 48605
(248)977-9604
enclosure
2

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules
except for the following:
R 400.12504 Eligibility requirements.
(1) An agency shall document the rationale for selection
of independent living as the most appropriate
placement for the youth.
Three independent living files were reviewed. One out of three
did not have the rationale why this placement was the
appropriate placement.
R 400.12504 Eligibility requirements.
(2) All of the following shall be in the case record before a
youth is placed in independent living:
(a) How the youth meets the eligibility requirements for
the specific program the youth is being placed into.
Three independent living files were reviewed. One out of three
did not have the documentation on how the youth meets
eligibility requirements.
R 400.12504 Eligibility requirements.
(2) All of the following shall be in the case record before a
youth is placed in independent living:
(e) An evaluation of a youth's need for supervision and a
plan for providing the level of supervision determined
necessary.
Three independent living files were reviewed. One out of three
did not have an evaluation of the level of supervision based on
the youth’s needs.
4

R 400.12509 Independent living record.
(3) The case record shall contain all of the following
information and documentation, which shall be recorded
within 30 calendar days after placement in independent
living and updated at least once every 90 calendar days:
(d) The names, dates of birth, and addresses of the
youth's siblings, if applicable.
Three independent living files were reviewed. Three out of three
did not have the names, dates of birth, and addresses of the
youth’s siblings. All three reported the siblings were active in
their life, but the above information was not included.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
R. 400.12509 (3)(o): Permanency plan for each child in care will need to be placed
in the initial service plan and updated service plans. Specific goals will need to be
outlined and updated.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was not offered consultation.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
AND
The agency has submitted #### acceptable corrective action plans not related
to maltreatment during this licensing period.
[Describe and assess the agency’s compliance with each individual Corrective
Action Plan for special investigations and licensing reviews].
VII. RECOMMENDATION
5

Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the facility continue on a regular license.
5/4/20
________________________________________
Venus M. Decker Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
May 12, 2020
